ReportSection.tooltip: Evaluation of the project report against the reporting rules
ReportSection.name: Report Completion Status
ReportSection.Instructions:
At this point, the PLs of Phase2 projects should add NIs to their projects (using the "Edit Member" tool). As soon as you add a new NI to your project, and after the request has been approved by Central, this person will be listed among your project NIs and will have your project in their list of projects. This will create a textbox in the "plans forward" part of their NI report and will also allow them to request funds in their budget for this project. NI budget requests can now be uploaded.

As a PL you are also expected to develop your new Phase2 project; the basic description has been added to the Forum by Central but there are no subprojects and no champions yet; the PLs are expected to complete this information. Note that you have to request a champion account ("Add Member") before you can add them to your project; once your request has been approved by Central, you can add them to your project and subprojects. Note that when the account creation is approved they will get and email from the Forum, so it would be advisable to warn them before through email.


This page provides an overview of the degree to which the project report and the project-related reports of the associated NIs are complete. Five aspects of the project report are inspected:

  • Regarding the products reported in the dashboard, the degree to which their descriptions are complete is examined. Note that there is no expectation of actual products associated with Phase2 projects since work on these projects is expected to start in April 2014. However, we anticipate that work may have already begun in some cases and the corresponding products may be reported.
  • Regarding the open-ended sections of the report, the number of text-boxes edited and whether or not any of them exceed the maximum number of characters allowed is reported.
  • Regarding the project milestones, this page mentions the number of milestones that are mentioned in the overview section of the "Project milestones" page.
  • Regarding the PL comments on the project NIs, the numbers of PNIs and CNIs on which you have commented are reported.
  • Regarding the progress of the project NIs, the following numbers are reported:
    1. project NIs who have not made a project-related request for the new year are reported; and
    2. project NIs that have not submitted "plans forward" associated with this project are reported.

In addition to the summary table under the heading "PL Progress", you can find details on the degree to which the project NIs have completed their reports.

  • Clicking on the "Report PDF" downloads a copy of the project-specific slice of the NI report, which includes project-related products, the executive summary and the NI’s comments associated with the project on the NCE criteria A through D.
  • Clicking on the "On-Line Report" button enables you to impersonate the NI in question and view the project-related slice of their report.
  • Clicking on the "Notify NI" lets you send a forum notification to the NI and (if you wish) an email message, with a communication regarding their report.
ReportSection.ReportItem: <style>#ni_completion table tr:first-child td:first-child {display:none;}</style><table id="ni_completion" style="background:#ffffff;" cellspacing='1' cellpadding='3' frame='box' rules='all'><tr><th>NI</th><th>Completion Status</th><th>Actions</th></tr>

ReportSection.tooltip: Overview of this year's activity and productivity
ReportSection.name: Project Dashboard
ReportSection.Instructions:
The Dashboard is designed to provide an overview of all project-related activity in GRAND, by all project NIs (each represented by a row in the Dashboard table) and overall (reflected in the final "Totals" row of the table). The data reported in the dashboard has already been input to the Forum through the various functionalities of the "Toolbox".

The project dashboard is compiled based on the data reported on the project-related rows of all the NIs of the project. The "Time and Budget" table of the project dashboard relies on the "Network" table of the NI dashboards. The "Productivity" table of the project dashboard relies on the “Productivity” table of the NI dashboards.

ReportSection.name: Project Report
ReportSection.Instructions:
The intent of this section is to enable the project PLs and co-PLs to report in an executive summary an overview of the project activity for the next year and their reflections on:

  1. the planned activities for the next year;
  2. the benefits to the project from being involved in the Network; and
  3. any additional comments they wish

ReportItemSet.ReportItem: II. Assessment: How {$project_name} contributes towards the NCE Evaluation Criteria

ReportItemSet.title: A. Excellence of the Research Program: How {$project_name} contributes to the Network
B. Development of Highly Qualified Personnel: {$project_name} strategies and achievements
C. Networking and Partnerships: {$project_name} successes in building linkages
D. Knowledge & Technology Exchange & Exploitation: {$project_name} efforts in disseminating research to receptors
Benefits of Networking: Benefits from being involved in the Network

ReportSection.name: Sub Projects
ReportSection.Instructions: This section shows the comments made by the sub-project leaders.

ReportSection.name: Project Budget Request
ReportSection.Instructions:
This section includes a roll-up of the Budget Requests for this project from each of the listed project PNIs and CNIs. Under "Budget Justification", there is a text field to allow for a brief comment on the overall budget request for this project.

The Budget Request table includes both PNI and CNI budget requests, imported from the budget requests that are included with their respective NI reports. The final PNI allocations will be based on the review by the RMC of individual NI reports of those PNIs. The allocations for the CNIs will be determined by the project. The RMC will determine the amount of CNI funding that will be made available to each project. However, please note that this amount will generally not exceed 60% of the total amount of PNI funding allocated to the project and that it will generally not be less than 40% of that amount. This roughly corresponds to the overall guideline across all projects that 2/3 of the NI research funding allocations will go to PNIs and 1/3 will go to CNIs. Where the amount requested for CNIs on a project exceeds the amount ultimately allocated, the final amount will be prorated among the CNIs requesting funds for the project, based on the amount of their reqests, unless the project leader provides a revised distribution within the timeframe provided at the time these project CNI allocations are announced. These allocations will be announced in March 2014.

ReportSection.name: Review
ReportSection.Instructions:
This section provides (a) an online document with all the information currently contained in the report pages, and (b) an online approximation of what the resulting PDF document will look like. If you are satisfied with this content, then you can proceed to the final step of the reporting workflow where you can "Submit" your report to be forwarded to the RMC.

As with the NI on-line report, over-limit characters are included in the online document, (where they are shown in red) but not in the PDF document. The "Milestones" section is not part of the document that will be reviewed by the Research Management Committee (RMC).

ReportSection.tooltip: PDF generation and submission to the RMC
ReportSection.name: Submit
ReportSection.Instructions:
To submit the project report, follow the following three steps.

  1. Generate a new report for submission: this step will generate three PDF documents: (a) the "Project Report PDF" is the document that will be forwarded to the RMC; (b) the "Project Milestones PDF" is for the project records; and (c) the "Project Comments PDF" includes all the co-PLs comments regarding the project NIs.
  2. Download the PDF documents for your records.
  3. Submit your report: this step indicates that you have read and approve the contents of the PDF document to be forwarded to the RMC. Note that "submitting" does not lock the reporting workflow; you can regenerate and resubmit your report as many times as you wish before the deadline, if you need to make additional edits to your report. The most recently submitted PDF is used for evaluation.
  4. Download the PDF which will be used for evaluation; To verify that the correct PDF will be used for evaluation, you can download the submitted PDF.
